lessons.title: Animals
lessons.preview_text: Discover your students' relationships with animals.

lessons.title: Blocks
lessons.preview_text: Two teams compete to connect blocks across a grid of letters drawn on the board. Each block maps to a question from the teacher's list.

lessons.title: Body Language
lessons.preview_text: Discuss examples of body language and cultural differences.

lessons.title: Class Experts
lessons.preview_text: Quiz your classmates about their favorite activities.

lessons.title: Clothes
lessons.preview_text: Students discuss their favorite styles, colors and brands.

lessons.title: Criss-Cross
lessons.preview_text: All the students stand-up and listen to the teacher's questions. They can only sit down when they correctly answer a question after raising their hand.

lessons.title: Daily Routine
lessons.preview_text: Students describe and compare their daily routines.

lessons.title: Dating
lessons.tagline: what are the norms for dating here?
lessons.preview_text: Instruct the teacher on the correct protocols!

lessons.title: Driving
lessons.preview_text: Discuss the pros and cons of driving, and owning a car.

lessons.title: English
lessons.preview_text: Icebreaker where students share their ideas for learning English.

lessons.title: Favourite Things
lessons.preview_text: Students repeat a simple sentence pattern, inserting their own nouns and adjectives. At the end, the real meaning of their choices are revealed!

lessons.title: Four Corners
lessons.preview_text: Students listen to the teacher's statements and decide if they agree or disagree, giving the reasons for their choice.

lessons.title: Gambling Quiz
lessons.preview_text: A quiz game with a twist - student teams gamble on their ability to answer the questions.

lessons.title: Games
lessons.preview_text: Pair and group discussion about playing games.

lessons.title: Geography
lessons.preview_text: Describe the geography of your own country.

lessons.title: Globalization
lessons.preview_text: What is globalization and how does it affect us?

lessons.title: Groups
lessons.preview_text: A variation on a simple 'put into the correct category' activity, students have to decide on categories for various lists of words.

lessons.title: Handling Difficulties
lessons.preview_text: ALTs working abroad can run into problems - but these shouldn't be allowed to detract from the overall positive experience of the position. Here are some tips to set yourself up to handle anything that arises.

lessons.title: How Do I?
lessons.preview_text: Students instruct the teacher how to perform a simple task - which the teacher performs - literally!

lessons.title: Jeopardy
lessons.preview_text: Teams compete to answer questions from various categories - choosing hidden questions from a range of available points.

lessons.title: Last Xmas
lessons.preview_text: A great, fun xmas-theme lesson with music, a gap-fill exercise, small prizes and the popular 'Pass the Parcel' party game.

lessons.title: Lesson Format
lessons.preview_text: Creating an effective lesson that works across differing classrooms is not easy, but this framework should provide a good foundation for developing your own style.

lessons.title: Making Things
lessons.preview_text: Are your students creative? Expressions with 'making..'.

lessons.title: Managing Your ALT Role
lessons.tagline: tips on being an effective Assistant Language Teacher
lessons.preview_text: The ALT role can be challenging, especially if it is your first experience of teaching and working abroad. Here are some notes on how to approach your time and manage your role as an ALT

lessons.title: Mangazine
lessons.preview_text: Students interpret parts of a story and put them into the correct order before creating a 'zine' from a single piece of paper.

lessons.title: Picture This
lessons.preview_text: A three-stage worksheet where students practice their reading, writing, listening and illustrating skills!

lessons.title: Pronunciation Journey
lessons.preview_text: Students choose one of two similarly pronounced words on a word tree.

lessons.title: Read and Run
lessons.preview_text: Each student in turn listens to a question from the teacher and then leads their team to determine the answer from the text.

lessons.title: Resources
lessons.tagline: resources for the Assistant Language Teacher
lessons.preview_text: As an ALT you are likely to be tasked with sourcing and creating lessons - often from the get-go! Developing a process to select and incorporate good material will greatly increase your efficiency.

lessons.title: Reviews
lessons.preview_text: Students write a short review about something that interests them - whether a movie, a song, a book or a favourite snack.

lessons.title: Same Difference
lessons.preview_text: Students list similarities and differences between two countries, and complete a spot-the-difference activity.

lessons.title: Senses
lessons.preview_text: Discuss the five senses, and your likes and dislikes.

lessons.title: Sharing Pictures
lessons.preview_text: Students write a description for a secret picture, then take turns to direct their team to recreate the picture.

lessons.title: Squares
lessons.preview_text: Students follow directions around a grid and perform some writing or drawing activity at each location.

lessons.title: Textbook Lessons
lessons.preview_text: Creating a lesson around the current page in the textbook can be tricky, but here are some ideas that you can apply to most material, while still creating a fun and interesting learning experience.

lessons.title: Unique Words
lessons.preview_text: Student teams write the most unique word they can think of for a list of given categories - only unique words win points.

lessons.title: Where Is It?
lessons.preview_text: Students listen to the teacher describe the location of objects and add them to their own picture template.

lessons.title: Who's Who?
lessons.preview_text: Students solve a puzzle based on given descriptions of people, using the clues to identify the name and age of each person.

lessons.title: Word Power
lessons.preview_text: A vocabulary worksheet where students test their understanding of the meaning and relationships of a range of words.
